thread.title: Russian Deputy PM says U.S. sanctions created investor uncertainty

title: Russian Deputy PM says U.S. sanctions created investor uncertainty
text:
April 10, 2018 / 7:45 AM / Updated 36 minutes ago Russian Deputy PM says U.S. sanctions created investor uncertainty Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian Deputy Prime Minister Arkady Dvorkovich said on Tuesday that new U.S. sanctions imposed against some Russian companies have created uncertainty for all investors. Russian Deputy Prime Minister Arkady Dvorkovich smiles during an interview at the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum (SPIEF), Russia, June 2, 2017. REUTERS/Sergei Karpukhin 
Dvorkovich said it was important for Russia to minimise this uncertainty. 
The United States imposed major sanctions on Friday against Russian businessmen, companies and government officials, striking at allies of President Vladimir Putin in one of Washington’s most aggressive moves to punish Moscow for its alleged meddling in the 2016 U.S. election and other “malign activity.” Reporting by Andrey Ostroukh; Editing by Christian Lowe
